snippet: Typhoon Haiyan delivered a crippling blow to the country’s midsection and appeared to have brought a heavy loss of life to cities, towns and villages.
abstract: Massive scale of devastation caused by Typhoon Haiyan becomes clearer three days after storm, which destroyed cities, towns and fishing villages across islands of the central Philippines; death toll continues to climb, with some estimates exceeding 10,000 in city of Tacloban alone; aid workers have struggled to reach ravaged areas because of damaged roads and airports, which were already some of worst in Southeast Asia.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gerry Mullany from Hong Kong, Floyd Whaley from Iloilo, Philippines, Austin Ramzy from Cebu, Mark Mazzetti from Washington, and Alan Feuer from New York.

lead_paragraph: Typhoon Haiyan delivered a crippling blow to the country’s midsection and appeared to have brought a heavy loss of life to cities, towns and villages.

headline.main: Vast Challenges for Philippines After Typhoon
headline.print_headline: Vast Challenges For Philippines After Typhoon
